short_description: Makes classification predictions based on a single decision tree model.
long_description: This function applies a single decision tree model for predicting each of the input test data items.

input_tables.name: ModelTableName
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the previously built model table on which to base the output probabilities.
input_tables.rDescription: Indicates whether to include model object, default value is FALSE.

argument_clauses.name: AttrTableGroupbyColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns on which attribute_table is partitioned. Each partition contains one attribute of the input data.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns on which attribute_table is partitioned. Each partition contains one attribute of the input data.

argument_clauses.name: AttrTablePidColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns that define the data point identifiers.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that define the data point identifiers.

argument_clauses.name: AttrTableValColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the column that contains the input values.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the column that contains the input values.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of input_table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of input_table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: OutputResponseProbDist
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to output probabilities. If this value is true, you must specify the model on which to base the output probabilities, either in this argument or in the “output.response.model” argument. The model table is the name of a previously built model object.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to output probabilities. If this value is true, you must specify the model on which to base the output probabilities, either in this argument or in the ModelTableName argument. The model_table is the name of a previously built model table.
